p: The HEV seroprevalence and viremia in blood donors was also shown to differ in Western countries (Table 1) [ 26– 40]. In the Southwest of France even 52% positive donors were found, here mainly due to the consumption of undercooked figatellu liver sausages [ 27]. Studies in Germany showed an anti-HEV IgG prevalence of 6.8% [ 41], the rate of HEV-positive donations was 1:4525 [ 42] and hepatitis E viraemia was found at a relatively high rate of 0.12% among blood donors in 2018 [ 42]. In comparison with Europe and the United States, the seroprevalence was lower in Latin America [ 43, 44]. In Switzerland on average 29.4% of blood samples were positive, the seroprevalence increased with age (30.7% of males and 34.2% of women over 60 years old) [ 4]. An increase of seropositive donors with age was also observed in France [ 27].
